title: NeRF$^\textbf{2}$: Neural Radio-Frequency Radiance Fields. (arXiv:2305.06118v1 [cs.NI])
abstract: Although Maxwell discovered the physical laws of electromagnetic waves 160 years ago, how to precisely model the propagation of an RF signal in an electrically large and complex environment remains a long-standing problem. The difficulty is in the complex interactions between the RF signal and the obstacles (e.g., reflection, diffraction, etc.). Inspired by the great success of using a neural network to describe the optical field in computer vision, we propose a neural radio-frequency radiance field, NeRF$^\textbf{2}$, which represents a continuous volumetric scene function that makes sense of an RF signal's propagation. Particularly, after training with a few signal measurements, NeRF$^\textbf{2}$ can tell how/what signal is received at any position when it knows the position of a transmitter. translated_abstract: 尽管迈克尔斯在160年前就发现了电磁波的物理定律，但如何精确地模拟电气大型和复杂环境中RF信号的传播仍然是一个长期存在的问题。困难在于RF信号与障碍物之间复杂的交互（例如反射，衍射等）。受在计算机视觉中使用神经网络描述光场的巨大成功的启发，我们提出了神经射频辐射场NeRF$^\textbf{2}$，它表示连续的体积场函数，使RF信号的传播变得有意义。特别地，通过使用几个信号测量进行训练，NeRF$^\textbf{2}$ 可以在知道发射机位置的情况下告诉我们在任何位置接收到怎样的信号。作为一个物理层的神经网络，NeRF$^\textbf{2}$可以利用已学习的统计模型和光线追踪的物理模型来生成合成数据集，以满足训练需求。
tldr: NeRF$^\textbf{2}$是一种利用神经网络描述射频辐射场的方法，可通过少量信号测量告诉我们在任何位置接收到的信号，具有良好的应用前景。
en_tdlr: NeRF$^\textbf{2}$ is a novel method that uses a neural network to describe radio-frequency radiance fields, which can tell us what signal is received at any position with a few signal measurements, and it has promising applications.
